channel.title: The system cannot find the path specified
channel.description:
Ok,
I've changed the jdk thing to 16 as that's my jdk version, it was originally 27. However, even though I've done everything I've been taught about this, I'm still getting the same error - The system cannot find the path specified. Please press any key to continue...
[code]@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program files (86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_16/bin\javac.exe" -cp bin -d bin src/*.java src/sign/*.java pause [/code]
^ Above is the code in which the compiler is now... Please could anyone correct me etc?
Please could someone give me a tip, do I need to renew my jdk version to 27, if so, would it be possible to give me a pointed as to where to go in order to download the new version, as I've searched around, and found nothing :S.

item.title: The system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @Chromeez Chromeez
item.description:
@Chromeez wrote:

Worked it out

It was @echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_16/bin\javac.exe" -cp bin -d bin src/*.java src/sign/*.java pause

jdk1.7.0_16\bin etc.

It needed to be a 6 in place of the 7.

Cheers for your help I would rep++ but I can’t, seeing as my rep isn’t 15…

Read full topic
item.source: The system cannot find the path specified

item.title: The system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @Roar337 Roar337
item.description:
@Roar337 wrote:


so
"C:\Program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_16\bin\javac.exe" -cp bin -d bin src/*.java src/sign/*.java

so
“C:\Program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_16\bin\javac.exe” -cp bin -d bin src/.java src/sign/.java

Read full topic
